intro: Lafoensia pacari f. alata, commonly known as the winged lafoensia, is a tropical plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive wing-like structures on its leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic in shape, and have a smooth texture with prominent veins. The flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and are clustered in racemes, making it an attractive ornamental plant.
